newsitem.title: USA: Virginia Power shuts North Anna 2 nuke plant.
newsitem.headline: Virginia Power shuts North Anna 2 nuke plant.

text.p: Virginia Power Co shut its 909 megawatt (MW) North Anna 2 nuclear power plant on Monday to repair a small leak in a high-pressure steam line, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) said Tuesday.
The NRC said in its daily status report that the unit was being kept on hot standby and was expected to return to operation some time Thursday.
The neighboring North Anna 1 was running at 100 percent of its 911 MW capacity, NRC said.
The North Anna complex is located in Mineral, Va.
Virginia Power is a subsidiary of Dominion Resources.
